meanings.definition: A system of government in which experts in technology and science make decisions.
meanings.sent1: In a technocracy, scientists and engineers lead the country.
meanings.sent2: The concept of technocracy emphasizes the importance of knowledge in governance.
meanings.sent3: The technocracy in this fictional world is run by robots and AI.
meanings.sent4: Her classroom operates like a mini technocracy, with the smartest students making decisions.
meanings.sent5: The technocracy of the future may rely heavily on artificial intelligence.

meanings.definition: The belief in the ability of technology to solve societal problems.
meanings.sent1: His unwavering faith in technocracy led him to support all technological advancements.
meanings.sent2: Technocracy suggests that innovation can address complex social issues.
meanings.sent3: The comedy skit humorously portrayed a world where technocracy solved all problems.
meanings.sent4: In her mind, technocracy was a superhero swooping in to save the day.
meanings.sent5: The book painted a vivid picture of a utopian society achieved through technocracy.
